So here is a roundup of the press stories relating to Spurs today. Pinch of salt required in places for sure.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino's plea to club hierarchy to be brave this summer in the transfer market appears to have been granted with the club moving quickly to try and secure transfer targets early in the window.

(Daily Mirror)
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Manchester United are confident they can sign Toby Alderweireld from Tottenham this summer with the North London club keen to sell.

(Daily Mirror)
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Chelsea having given up in their pursuit of Mauricio Pochettino after being told he would not ever consider leaving Tottenham for a local rival.

(The Sun)
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Mousa Dembele is said to be considering a mega money deal to move to China after the World Cup.

(The Sun)
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Daniel Levy is fearing a Liverpool win in the Champions League final could see Tottenham lose their manager to Real Madrid. The Argentine has held positive talks with the chairman but is seemingly more and more frustrated by Tottenhams financial position. Real Madrid have Pochettino as their number one target should they decide to sack their current manager.

(Marca)
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Pochettino has put Colombian midfield enforcer Wilmar Barrios on his summer transfer target list as he looks to add more bite and options in the Spurs midifeld. Barrios, 24, plays in Argentina for Boca and has been selected for Colombia at the world cup.

(The Sun)
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Tottenham are in negotiations with Real Madrid to re sign Gareth Bale for a deal in the region of £48m. The only stumbling block is the players wage demands believed to be in the region of £350,000 a week.

(Daily Star)
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Tottenham are close to agreement over a deal for Barcelona teenager Riqui Puig. The 18-year-old has failed to agree terms with the Spanish champions over a new contract and is keen to move to London and link up with Mauricio Pochettino. Puig, who turns 19 in August is highly rated in Spain.

(Daily Mail)

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Frank Lampard has called on Gareth Southgate to name Harry Kane has England captain claiming he is a 'talisman' for the nation much like Alan Shearer was.

(BT Sports)
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Spurs will be watching the Championship play off final with great interest as their hopes to sign Ryan Sessegnon could rest on Fulham failing to win promotion. Should the Cottagers make their Premier League return the player is said to be happy at Fulham.

(Sky Sports News)
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Stories from the press & media on Sunday 20th May 2018.
